page.title: 15General Background
page.content: middle of the 12th century and a Quaker Chapel built in 1881. Elsenham and the surrounding area still has a large number of old houses and thatched cottages, open fields and public footpaths but it is modern housing that predominates; mainly 3 bedroom or large semi-detached or detached houses. The expansion of Stansted Airport is the issue of the moment. It is likely to bring emloyment to the area, but also an increase in noise. It is expected that Elsenham railway station will expand, and that there will be much building of houses and roads were the consequent rise in house prices. Many people, though, fear that the rural nature and peace of the area will be destroyed.
